name: Ghost Step Tattoo
description: This tattoo shifts and wavers on the skin, parts of it appearing to phase in and out of existence. The tattoo has 3 charges, and it regains all expended charges daily at dawn. As a Bonus Action, you can expend 1 of the tattoo's charges to become incorporeal until the end of your next turn. For the duration, you gain the following benefits: you have Resistance to Bludgeoning, Piercing, and Slashing damage from nonmagical attacks; you can't be Grappled or Restrained; you can move through creatures and solid objects as if they were Difficult Terrain. If you end your turn inside a solid object, you take 1d10 Force damage.
